1.description: A student at Experiment House who is being bullied. She meets Eustace Scrubb behind the gym and follows him through a door that leads to Aslan's Country.

2.description: Chosen by Aslan to help rescue Prince Rilian. She is given four Signs to remember, though she struggles with her fear of heights and tendency to show off.

3.description: Arrives in Narnia with Eustace but fails to recognize the aged King Caspian, missing the first Sign. She begins to realize the weight of her mission.

12.description: Helps break the silver chair that binds Prince Rilian's mind, despite her initial fear. Shows courage when it matters most.

16.description: Returns to Experiment House changed by her adventures, with new confidence to stand up to the bullies. Helps reform the school with Eustace.

1.description: A reformed student at Experiment House, much changed from his previous adventures. He befriends Jill and leads her to a door that opens to Aslan's Country.

2.description: Experienced in Narnia from his previous voyage on the Dawn Treader. Chosen to accompany Jill on the quest to find Prince Rilian, though he accidentally falls off the cliff.

relationships.King Caspian X: Old friend from the Dawn Treader

3.description: Reunited with his old friend King Caspian, though saddened by how aged and frail the king has become. Committed to finding the missing prince.

5.description: A Marsh-wiggle who serves as guide to Jill and Eustace. Known for his pessimistic outlook and practical nature, he agrees to help them find the giant bridge mentioned in the Signs.

8.description: Leads the children to Harfang, though he has doubts about the giants' hospitality. His pessimism proves warranted as he suspects danger.

12.description: Shows incredible bravery by stamping out the witch's fire, breaking her enchantment despite severe burns to his foot. His courage saves them all from the spell.

3.description: The missing son of King Caspian, who disappeared years ago while hunting the serpent that killed his mother. The object of the quest that Jill and Eustace have been sent to complete.

10.description: Appears as the mysterious Black Knight who serves the Lady of the Green Kirtle. He is under her enchantment and believes Narnia is just a dream.

12.description: Freed from the witch's spell when the silver chair is destroyed. Remembers his true identity as Prince of Narnia and his father King Caspian.

7.description: A beautiful lady in green who encounters the travelers on their journey north. She appears helpful and directs them to Harfang, though something feels unsettling about her.

10.description: Revealed as the queen of the underground realm, keeping Prince Rilian under her spell. She plans to use him to conquer Narnia.

12.description: Attempts to enchant the rescuers with her magic fire and silver chair, making them forget Narnia exists. When this fails, she transforms into a deadly green serpent.

relationships.Prince Rilian: Kills her in her serpent form

2.description: Now an old king of Narnia, desperate to find his missing son Prince Rilian before he dies. He is about to embark on a voyage to search for him.

relationships.Prince Rilian: Father searching for his missing son

3.description: Departs Narnia on what will be his final voyage, leaving the kingdom in the hands of his regents. Eustace fails to recognize how aged his old friend has become.

relationships.Eustace Scrubb: Old friend from the Dawn Treader

15.description: Dies shortly after his son's return, passing away peacefully knowing Prince Rilian is safe and will rule Narnia well.

16.description: Brought back to life by Aslan in Aslan's Country, appearing young and strong again. Joins Aslan and the children in dealing with the bullies at Experiment House.

relationships.Jill Pole: Met properly for the first time

2.description: The great lion who calls Jill and Eustace to Narnia for their mission. He gives Jill four Signs to remember and warns her of the importance of following them exactly.

16.description: Appears in Aslan's Country and brings King Caspian back to life. He helps the children deal with the bullies at Experiment House and ensures justice is done.

4.description: A talking owl who finds Jill and Eustace when they arrive in Narnia. He carries them to Cair Paravel and helps them understand their situation.

5.description: Brings the children to the Parliament of Owls, where they learn more about Prince Rilian's disappearance and receive guidance for their quest.

relationships.Prince Rilian: Knows the story of his disappearance

3.description: Now a very old dwarf serving as one of King Caspian's regents. He is present when the children arrive at Cair Paravel, though his age has made him quite deaf.
The faithful ship's captain who sailed with Caspian on the Dawn Treader and now serves as one of his regents. He accompanies the king on his final voyage.

relationships.Eustace Scrubb: Remembers from the Dawn Treader voyage

5.description: A gathering of wise owls who hold council and provide guidance. They tell the children about Prince Rilian's disappearance and the serpent that killed his mother.

relationships.Prince Rilian: Know the story of his loss

8.description: The ruler of the giants at Harfang castle. Initially appears hospitable to the travelers, offering them warm shelter and food.

9.description: Revealed to have been planning to eat the children and Puddleglum at the Autumn Feast, viewing them as delicacies rather than honored guests.

8.description: The queen of Harfang who welcomes the travelers warmly. She appears motherly and kind, fussing over Jill especially.

9.description: Revealed to be complicit in the plan to eat the travelers, discussing the best way to prepare them for the feast.

8.description: A young giant prince at Harfang who is fascinated by the small visitors and treats them somewhat like pets or toys.
A giant woman who serves as nurse at Harfang castle, helping to care for the travelers and prepare them for what she believes will be their comfortable stay.

9.description: The castle cook who is planning the preparation of the travelers for the Autumn Feast, discussing recipes and cooking methods.

11.description: An earthman (gnome) who serves as warden in the Lady's underground realm. Initially appears hostile and threatening to the captured travelers.

13.description: After the witch's death, reveals that the earthmen were also under her spell. He explains they were originally from the bright land of Bism far below and longed to return home.
An enormous sleeping giant found in the depths of Underland. He sleeps until the end of Narnia comes, when he will wake to help put out the sun and stars.

10.description: Strange underground creatures who serve the Lady of the Green Kirtle in her realm. They appear sad and oppressed, working without joy.

13.description: Revealed to be under the witch's spell, they celebrate their freedom after her death and prepare to return to their true home in the deep country of Bism.

relationships.Bism: True homeland they long to return to

16.description: Terrified by the appearance of Aslan and Caspian, leading to nervous breakdown and resignation. The school is reformed under new leadership.

1.description: One of the main bullies at Experiment House who torments Jill and other students. He is part of the gang that chases them behind the gym.

16.description: Receives his comeuppance when Jill and Eustace, empowered by their Narnia adventures, stand up to him and the other bullies.

1.description: A particularly nasty female bully at Experiment House who takes pleasure in tormenting younger or weaker students like Jill.

16.description: Among the bullies who flee in terror from the transformed Jill and Eustace, no longer able to intimidate them.

1.description: One of the senior bullies at Experiment House, part of the gang that makes life miserable for students like Jill and Eustace.
Twin brothers who are part of the bullying gang at Experiment House, making life difficult for their fellow students.
Another member of the bullying gang at Experiment House who participates in making school life miserable for vulnerable students.
Eustace's mother, mentioned as someone who subscribes to the modern educational philosophies that make Experiment House such a problematic school.
Eustace's father, who along with his wife believes in the experimental educational methods that have made their son's school a difficult place.

16.description: Students at Experiment House who were previously too frightened to stand up to the bullies but who rally around Jill and Eustace when they return transformed from their adventure.
The sensible new head teacher who takes over Experiment House after the previous head's breakdown, implementing proper discipline and ending the bullying problem.

8.description: The various giants who inhabit Harfang castle, including courtiers, servants, and guards who initially seem hospitable to the travelers.

9.description: Revealed to be complicit in or aware of the plan to eat the travelers at the Autumn Feast, viewing humans and Marsh-wiggles as delicacies.

8.description: Giant guards who watch over Harfang castle and initially welcome the travelers as guests, not revealing their true intentions.

14.description: Earthmen from the deepest realm of Bism who call up to their enslaved brethren, inviting them to return home to their bright, fiery homeland far below the surface.
14.role: Free earthmen of the deep lands

relationships.Bism: Inhabitants of the bright deep realm

14.description: Creatures of living fire that inhabit the deepest realm of Bism, visible as bright flames in the depths below the earthmen's homeland.

5.description: The various owls who make up the Parliament besides Glimfeather, each contributing their wisdom and knowledge about Prince Rilian's disappearance.

3.description: The various servants and courtiers who remain at Cair Paravel while King Caspian is away on his final voyage, maintaining the castle and assisting the regents.

10.description: A beautiful silver chair in the Lady's underground palace that serves as both throne and instrument of enchantment.

12.description: The chair that must be destroyed to break Prince Rilian's enchantment. When the rescuers break it apart, the spell over the prince is finally lifted.

5.description: The serpent that killed Prince Rilian's mother, the Queen of Narnia, during a picnic. This tragedy led to Rilian's obsession with hunting the creature.

12.description: Revealed to be the transformed shape of the Lady of the Green Kirtle. Prince Rilian kills the serpent, finally avenging his mother's death.

3.description: Noble centaurs of Narnia who serve as advisors and counselors, mentioned as being among those consulted about Prince Rilian's disappearance.
The intelligent horses of Narnia who serve in the royal stables and can speak, mentioned as being part of the search for Prince Rilian.
The dwarf citizens of Narnia, both Red and Black Dwarfs, who serve the crown and were involved in searching for the missing prince.
The various talking animals of Narnia including bears, badgers, rabbits, and others who are concerned about their missing prince and the aging king.
The water nymphs and tree spirits of Narnia who are connected to the natural world and deeply concerned about the kingdom's troubles.

1.description: The ineffectual teaching staff at Experiment House who follow the Head's progressive theories and fail to address the serious bullying problem.

16.description: Many are replaced or reformed under the new leadership that takes over after the Head's breakdown and resignation.
Government inspectors who investigate Experiment House after the Head's breakdown, leading to major reforms in the school's administration and policies.

5.description: The community of Marsh-wiggles living in the Eastern Marshes of Narnia, known for their pessimistic but practical nature like Puddleglum.

15.description: The various woodland creatures and spirits who gather to celebrate Prince Rilian's return and mourn King Caspian's passing.

1.description: A teacher at Experiment House who is supposed to provide physical education but, like the rest of the staff, fails to maintain proper discipline or address bullying.

12.description: Earthmen who provide the hypnotic music that accompanies the Lady of the Green Kirtle's enchantment spell, playing instruments to help weave her magic.

14.description: Earthmen from the deepest levels of Bism who call up to guide their enslaved brethren home to the bright, fiery country far below.

9.description: The giant cooks and kitchen staff preparing for the Autumn Feast, discussing recipes and methods for preparing the travelers as the main course.

8.description: Giant entertainers who perform at Harfang castle, providing music and entertainment for the court and their 'guests.'
The noble giants who make up the court at Harfang castle, appearing civilized and courtly while harboring cannibalistic intentions.

relationships.Eustace Scrubb: Edmund and Lucy are cousins to

recaps.1: Jill Pole is being bullied at the horrible Experiment House school when she meets the transformed Eustace Scrubb behind the gymnasium. Together they call on 'someone' for help and find themselves going through a door that leads to Aslan's Country, though Eustace accidentally falls off a high cliff.
recaps.2: In Aslan's Country, Jill meets the great lion Aslan, who explains that Eustace has been blown to Narnia and that she must join him on a quest to find the lost Prince Rilian. Aslan gives her four Signs to remember: recognize an old friend, journey north to the ruined giant city, find the writing 'UNDER ME,' and rescue the first person who asks her to do something in Aslan's name.
recaps.3: Jill arrives in Narnia and is reunited with Eustace at Cair Paravel, but she fails to recognize the aged King Caspian, missing the first Sign. They meet the elderly Trumpkin and learn that the king has departed on his final voyage to search for his missing son Prince Rilian.
recaps.4: Glimfeather the owl finds Jill and Eustace and carries them safely to Cair Paravel, where they learn more about their situation and the gravity of their mission to find Prince Rilian before King Caspian returns or dies.
recaps.5: The owl Glimfeather takes the children to a Parliament of Owls, where they learn the tragic story of Prince Rilian's disappearance. The prince vanished years ago while hunting the serpent that killed his mother, the queen, and was last seen with a beautiful lady in green.
recaps.6: The children and their new guide, Puddleglum the Marsh-wiggle, begin their journey northward from the marshes. They travel across the moors toward the giant lands, following the second Sign to reach the ruined city of the ancient giants.
recaps.7: The travelers encounter a beautiful lady dressed all in green, riding a horse, who seems helpful and charming. She directs them to the castle of Harfang, where she says the giants will give them warm hospitality during the cold autumn weather, though Puddleglum remains suspicious.
recaps.8: The travelers arrive at Harfang castle and are welcomed warmly by the King and Queen of the giants, who treat them as honored guests. They are given comfortable rooms, hot baths, and delicious food, though something feels slightly unsettling about their hosts' eagerness.
recaps.9: Jill discovers that the giants plan to eat them at the Autumn Feast, viewing them as delicacies rather than guests. The travelers escape from Harfang castle and find themselves at the ruined giant city mentioned in the Signs, where they discover the words 'UNDER ME' carved in the ancient stones.
recaps.10: Following the third Sign, the travelers go underground through a gap in the ruins and find themselves in a dark, lampless world ruled by the Lady of the Green Kirtle. They are captured and brought before her mysterious Black Knight, who serves her completely and believes the upper world is just a dream.
recaps.11: The travelers are imprisoned in the underground realm by Golg and other earthmen who serve the Lady of the Green Kirtle. They learn more about this strange underworld kingdom where the earthmen work joylessly and the Black Knight is the queen's champion.
recaps.12: The Lady of the Green Kirtle attempts to enchant the travelers with her magic fire and music, making them forget that Narnia exists, but Puddleglum breaks the spell by stamping out the fire. The Black Knight is revealed to be Prince Rilian, freed from his enchantment when they destroy the silver chair that bound him, and together they kill the witch when she transforms into a deadly serpent.
recaps.13: With the witch dead, Prince Rilian and the travelers discover that the earthmen were also under her spell and are now free to return to their home in the deep country of Bism. The group encounters the sleeping Father Time and prepares to return to the surface world.
recaps.14: The travelers and Prince Rilian make their way up through the underground passages toward the surface, passing through different levels of the underworld and witnessing the earthmen's joyful departure to their true home in the bright land of Bism far below.
recaps.15: Prince Rilian and the travelers return to the surface and make their way back to Cair Paravel, where they arrive just in time for Rilian to be reunited with his dying father, King Caspian. The king dies peacefully, knowing his son is safe and will rule Narnia well.
recaps.16: Aslan appears and takes Jill and Eustace back to his country, where he brings King Caspian back to life, appearing young and strong again. Together they return briefly to Experiment House, where Aslan and Caspian help deal with the bullies, leading to the head's resignation and the school's reform, while Jill and Eustace find they are no longer afraid of anyone.
